li.a: School Counselor School Closure Resource Page

main.div: You are here: Home / Resources for School Closure

p.b: The Dr. Lewis S. Libby School

div.p:
When you sign up to get a ​Meals-to-You​, every other week you’ll get a box delivered to your home for each child ages 1-18 in your household. Each box will include 10 breakfasts and 10 lunches/suppers–enough food for each child for two weeks!
All foods are shelf stable which means you don’t have to worry about them expiring anytime soon. With this program you don’t have to worry about extra trips to the grocery store, extra money spent on food or transportation concerns. HOW DO YOU SIGN UP? All you have to do is fill out an online sign-up form and submit it as soon as possible – BEFORE Wednesday, April 8th! Access the online form by clicking this link: ​https://mealstoyou.org/emergency-meals-to-you-application/​ If you are unable to sign up online please call Donna Conary at 207-370-9060​ or ​827-2252 ext. 103.
School Closure Assignments Please access pdfs by grade level here.

p.b: The Dr. Lewis S. Libby School
Pre K-Grade 8 Resources for School Closure

p.span: Please find below optional resources you can use
to assist your child in maintaining academic skills and passion for learning during this unexpected school closure.

**Please note these lists have been quickly assembled, and that each site has not been vetted or endorsed by the Milford School Department or it’s employees. Parents/Caregivers, please be sure to monitor your child’s internet use.

td.span: Khan Academy/Reading Comprehension. It is grouped by grade level:

a.span: Reading A to Z / Raz kids
mrnussbaum’s features over 10,000 learning games for ages 5-14 across subjects FREE
mrnussbaum’s features over 10,000 learning games for ages 5-14 across subjects FREE
Brain Pop a Variety of Subjects
Brain Pop A variety of subjects
ASU Virtual Field Trip: Science, Social Studies, STEM 6-8
Lunch Doodles with Mo Willems: New episodes will be posted each weekdays at 1:00 p.m. ET

p.span: -Online PE lessons for all grade levels
free access for two great online learning experiences through Infobase. Please see the links and login information below.
– 200 free kids educational resources: Video Lessons, APPS, Books, Websites & More
s- Free lesson plans for all areas, activity ideas and resources for elementary teachers
– Shared resources for virtual learning in emergency school closure. There A LOT of resources here to scroll through. Good information for EVERY grade level
It’s time to explore the world
– Math, ELA, SS, Science, Photography all grade levels

a.span: 150 ideas for sensory at home learning

p.b: Thank you @ First Grade Fun Times for this List!

td.b: Platform Where Read Aloud Will Happen

td.span: Listen to Grace read and draw with her too!
The Dot, Ish, Be You & More
A book a day until the world gets better
A book a day! Also writing tips and other fun stuff.
Lots of his books! Already posted on his YouTube channel!
Daily read alouds being uploaded to his YouTube Channel
Many picture book read-alouds and first-chapter read alouds
Lots of authors reading and talking about their books
An entire YouTube channel with authors reading aloud and sharing other educational videos for your use at home
many stories read aloud in multiple languages
Storybooks read by actors and actresses

p.span: A Padlet with lots of STEAM project ideas easy to do at home!

div.p: Mrs. Lindemann wanted to share some great news with you! We have two students who placed in their age category for the state Duck Stamp competition put on by L.L. Bean every year. Congratulations to 3rd place winner, 7th grader Haley Moores and 2nd place winner, 8th grader Peter Harrington! Haley Moores – Black […]
